subject: Programming
title: Test-Driven Development
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Test-Driven Development.

hook.text: Write the test before the code? That sounds backwards â€” until you try it.

buildup.text: TDD cycles through three steps: write a failing test, make it pass, then refactor.

discovery.text: Tests written first define what the code should do. The code exists only to satisfy the test.

twist.text: TDD feels slow at first. But it catches bugs immediately and builds a safety net as you go.

climax.text: With TDD, refactoring becomes fearless. Every change is verified by the existing test suite.

punchline.text: Red, green, refactor â€” the rhythm of confident code.

quiz.question: What are the three steps of TDD?
options: Write failing test, make it pass, refactor
